channel.title: Compiler Error - *.java

item.title: Compiler Error - *.java
item.dc:creator: @randomness15 randomness15
item.description:
@randomness15 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Oh this is the wrong section. Do you have all your .Java files in a folder like src or javafiles?

No, they’re just littered throughout the client folder, mixed in with the class files (In the client folder).

Now I do have an src folder in the source folder though.

I get the same error no matter what source and client I used, whether I’m trying to run a client compiler or source compiler.
I’m thinking it might be a java problem?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error - *.java
item.dc:creator: @randomness15 randomness15
item.description:
@randomness15 wrote:

Oh no, I know that.

All my compiler is comprised of is :
@echo off
Title Compiler
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin\javac.exe” *.java
pause

What would I replace the *.java with for it to run correctly?

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error - *.java
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Right click compiler and click edit.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error - *.java
item.dc:creator: @randomness15 randomness15
item.description:
@randomness15 wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

*.Java means to compile every .Java file in the package. So it looks like its being told to compile every .Java file in the package where the compiler is. Find the *.Java in your compiler code that has no route to a specified package. Just *.Java alone.

Within the client files? If so, the error occurs regardless of the client/source used.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error - *.java

item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

*.Java means to compile every .Java file in the package. So it looks like its being told to compile every .Java file in the package where the compiler is. Find the *.Java in your compiler code that has no route to a specified package. Just *.Java alone.

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler Error - *.java
item.dc:creator: @randomness15 randomness15
item.description:
@randomness15 wrote:

Alright, I keep getting an error when attempting to run my compiler. I’m quite certain I have path and classpath variables set correctly.
I looked through the common compiler errors thread and didn’t see anything like the error I’m getting.

This is the error :

Could anyone help me figure out the problem please?
Thanks

My path is C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\bin;

and my classpath is CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.7.0_05\jre\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

Read full topic
